title: UNBELIEVABLE! Georgia Court HALTS Trump's Case - Talking Feds - Democratic Underground Forums
text: [Create a free account](/?com=login&create=1)Support DU (and get rid of ads!): [Become a Star Member](/star) [Latest Breaking News](/?com=forum&id=1014) [General Discussion](/?com=forum&id=1002) [The DU Lounge](/?com=forum&id=1018) [All Forums](/?com=forums) [Issue Forums](/?com=forum&id=1311) [Culture Forums](/?com=forum&id=1312) [Alliance Forums](/?com=forum&id=1313) [Region Forums](/?com=forum&id=1314) [Support Forums](/?com=forum&id=1315) [Help & Search](/?com=search) Related: [Liberal YouTubers](/?com=forum&id=1322) [About this forum](/?com=about&forum=1322) (208,692 posts) Thu Jun 6, 2024, 05:58 PM 43 min ago [Rhiannon12866](/?com=profile&uid=122580) The Georgia Court of Appeals stayed Trump's election interference case in the trial court until oral arguments are held in October about DA Fani Willis's alleged conflict of interest. Harry weighs in with his own analysis. - 06/06/2024. [InfoView thread info, including edit history](/?com=thread&info=1&address=132225835) [TrashPut this thread in your Trash Can (My DU » Trash Can)](/?com=login) [BookmarkAdd this thread to your Bookmarks (My DU » Bookmarks)](/?com=login)6 replies, 230 views [ShareGet links to this post and/or share on social media] [AlertAlert this post for a rule violation](/?com=login) [PowersThere are no powers you can use on this post] [EditCannot edit other people's posts] [ReplyReply to this post](/?com=post&post&forum=1322&pid=25835) [EditCannot edit other people's posts] [Rec (2)] [ReplyReply to this post](/?com=post&forum=1322&pid=25835) [NoneDon't highlight anything](#!) [5 newestHighlight 5 most recent replies](#!) [The GA fix is in. Like in Florida.](#post1)Irish_Dem 43 min ago #1 [I am so sick of this, he has to know now that he faces even more serious convictions, but believes he's above the law](#post2)Rhiannon12866 27 min ago #2 [He is knocking out the trials, one by one.](#post3)Irish_Dem 23 min ago #3 [Since he's gotten millions fewer votes each time he ran, I'm counting on this trend to continue](#post4)Rhiannon12866 19 min ago #4 [I agree, he cannot win honestly.](#post5)Irish_Dem 10 min ago #5 [That's the thing, I'm listening to Liz Cheney's book in my car and the details she chronicles are sickening](#post6)Rhiannon12866 17 sec ago #6 [Rhiannon12866 (Original post)](#op) [Irish_Dem (Reply #1)](#post1) [Rhiannon12866 (Reply #2)](#post2) If he can hang in there until election day he may have a chance to end all of the trials once and for all. And nullify his convictions and fines, one way or the other. [Irish_Dem (Reply #3)](#post3) And that all his most serious trials will continue. *fingers crossed* [Rhiannon12866 (Reply #4)](#post4) [Irish_Dem (Reply #5)](#post5) It's been shown over and over that he has no concern for the American people, no knowledge or concern for the Constitution nor the rule of law, is only running for money and power - and to stay out of prison. And he completely ignored the investigations into the election he commissioned which told him he lost and the same conclusions from those in his administration. As Liz Cheney predicted, he won't make that mistake again, will only surround himself with those who will tell him what he wants to hear and is plotting even now how to overthrow yet another election.
